turns.content: future growth of e-commerce in Malaysia with reference and citation

The e-commerce industry in Malaysia has been growing rapidly over the past few years, and is expected to continue to grow in the future. According to a report by Google, Temasek, and Bain & Company, the e-commerce market in Malaysia is expected to be worth US$30 billion by 2025, with an annual growth rate of 24.8% from 2020 to 2025 (1).

One of the factors contributing to the growth of e-commerce in Malaysia is the increasing adoption of smartphones and internet connectivity. As of 2021, Malaysia has a smartphone penetration rate of 78.9%, which is one of the highest in the region (2). This has led to an increase in online shopping, with more consumers turning to e-commerce platforms to purchase goods and services.

Another factor is the COVID-19 pandemic, which has accelerated the growth of e-commerce globally, including in Malaysia. With movement restrictions and social distancing measures in place, more consumers are turning to e-commerce to purchase essential items, as well as non-essential items.

The Malaysian government has also taken steps to support the growth of e-commerce. In 2020, the government launched the National E-commerce Strategic Roadmap, which aims to double the growth rate of the e-commerce industry by 2025 (3). The government has also provided financial incentives and tax breaks to encourage businesses to adopt e-commerce.

In conclusion, the e-commerce industry in Malaysia is expected to continue to grow in the future, driven by factors such as increasing smartphone penetration, the COVID-19 pandemic, and government support. With a market size projected to reach US$30 billion by 2025, there are significant opportunities for businesses to tap into this growing market.
